title: The Transfiguration and Faith
shortSummary: Matthew 17 recounts the profound event of Jesus’ transfiguration, revealing His divine glory to Peter, James, and John. The chapter also addresses the fulfillment of prophecy through John the Baptist, Jesus’ teaching on faith and prayer, and concludes with a lesson on humility and God’s provision regarding the temple tax.
timeline: c. AD 30 - Ministry of Jesus in Galilee

keyCharacters.name: Jesus
keyCharacters.description: The Son of God who is transfigured, teaches about faith, and demonstrates His authority over sickness and earthly matters.

keyCharacters.name: Peter
keyCharacters.description: One of Jesus’ closest disciples who witnesses the transfiguration and responds with a desire to honor Jesus, Moses, and Elijah.

keyCharacters.name: James
keyCharacters.description: Brother of John and one of the three disciples present at the transfiguration.

keyCharacters.name: John
keyCharacters.description: Brother of James and one of the three disciples present at the transfiguration.

keyCharacters.name: John the Baptist
keyCharacters.description: Referred to as Elijah who was to come first, fulfilling prophecy and preparing the way for Jesus.

definitions.definition: A supernatural transformation revealing Jesus’ divine glory, where His face shone like the sun and His garments became dazzling white.
The Greek form of Elijah, the Old Testament prophet expected to return before the Messiah.
A very small seed used by Jesus as a metaphor for faith’s potential to accomplish great things.
Temporary shelters or booths; Peter’s suggestion to build these was an attempt to prolong the divine encounter on the mountain.
A tax paid to the governing authorities, here referring to the temple tax required of Jewish males.

outline.heading: The Transfiguration of Jesus
outline.description: Jesus is transfigured on a high mountain before Peter, James, and John, revealing His divine glory alongside Moses and Elijah. God’s voice affirms Jesus as His beloved Son, emphasizing the importance of listening to Him.

outline.heading: Jesus Explains the Coming of Elijah
outline.description: Jesus instructs the disciples to keep the vision secret until after His resurrection and clarifies that John the Baptist fulfilled the prophecy of Elijah’s return.

outline.heading: Healing of the Lunatic Boy
outline.description: Jesus heals a boy possessed by a demon after the disciples fail, teaching that faith and prayer are essential for spiritual authority and miracles.

outline.heading: Jesus Predicts His Death and Resurrection
outline.description: Jesus foretells His betrayal, death, and resurrection, preparing His disciples for the suffering He must endure.

outline.heading: The Temple Tax and God’s Provision
outline.description: Jesus teaches about the temple tax, affirming that as God’s Son He is exempt but instructs Peter to pay the tax to avoid causing offense, demonstrating God’s provision through a miraculous catch of a fish.

application: Trust in God’s power through faith, even if it is as small as a mustard seed, to overcome challenges and obstacles in life.
Listen attentively to Jesus as the authoritative Son of God, especially in times of spiritual revelation or decision-making.
Approach prayer and fasting as vital disciplines for spiritual breakthrough and victory over difficult situations.
Obey God’s instructions with humility and trust in His provision, even in practical matters like finances or societal obligations.

keyVerses.text: While he yet spake, behold, a bright cloud overshadowed them: and behold a voice out of the cloud, which said, This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; hear ye him.
keyVerses.significance: This verse affirms Jesus’ divine sonship and authority, commanding the disciples to listen to Him above all.

keyVerses.text: And Jesus said unto them, Because of your unbelief: for verily I say unto you, If ye have faith as a grain of mustard seed, ye shall say unto this mountain, Remove hence to yonder place; and it shall remove; and nothing shall be impossible unto you.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches the power of even small faith to accomplish great things through God’s power.

keyVerses.text: And Jesus rebuked the devil; and he departed out of him: and the child was cured from that very hour.
keyVerses.significance: This verse demonstrates Jesus’ authority over demonic forces and His power to heal and restore.

keyVerses.text: Notwithstanding, lest we should offend them, go thou to the sea, and cast an hook, and take up the fish that first cometh up; and when thou hast opened his mouth, thou shalt find a piece of money: that take, and give unto them for me and thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse shows Jesus’ miraculous provision and His teaching on humility and avoiding unnecessary offense.
